intro: Parosela walkerae, commonly known as the Walker's parosela, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It grows in rocky or dry habitats and is often found in areas with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
